column_description: Represents the specific error code associated with failed transactions in the payment system. This column is used to categorize and track different types of transaction failures for monitoring and analysis purposes, enabling identification of error patterns and failure trends across different banks and time periods.

This column categorizes payment transactions into different account or business types (such as MANDATE, P2P, Paytm QR, 3P QR, P2M Collect, Intent) based on transaction characteristics like category, channel, and initiation mode. It is used to segment success rate analysis across different payment methods and account types in the transaction processing system.

Represents the monetary value of each transaction in the payment system, stored as a decimal with 2 decimal places for currency precision. This column is used alongside transaction status and other attributes to analyze payment volumes and success rates across different transaction types and channels.

Application response code indicating the reason for transaction failure or success, used primarily for error tracking and failure analysis across different banks and time periods. This varchar field stores standardized codes that help categorize and monitor transaction outcomes for operational reporting.

A standardized code representing banking system error or response codes used to categorize and track transaction failures or statuses in payment processing systems. This column is primarily used for monitoring transaction error patterns and calculating failure growth metrics across different time periods.

Specifies the type of UPI business transaction, with 'MANDATE' indicating recurring payment mandates and null or other values typically representing standard peer-to-peer or merchant transactions. This field is used to categorize and route different types of payment flows in the UPI ecosystem.

Categorizes the type of payment transaction (e.g., VPA2MERCHANT, VPA2VPA, VPA2ACCOUNT) used for business logic classification and failure analysis in payment processing systems. This field helps distinguish between different payment flows like peer-to-peer transfers, merchant payments, and account transfers for operational monitoring and error tracking.

A varchar field that identifies the payment channel or platform through which a transaction was initiated, used to categorize transactions into different business segments like Paytm QR, 3P QR, Intent payments, etc. This column is essential for channel-wise success rate analysis and transaction categorization in payment processing workflows.

Timestamp indicating when a transaction record was created in the system, used for time-based filtering and comparative analysis of transaction failures across different time periods. This column enables day-over-day and hour-over-hour comparisons for monitoring transaction error patterns and calculating failure growth rates.

This date column tracks when each record in the transaction snapshot was last updated by the data pipeline, serving as an audit timestamp to ensure data freshness for time-sensitive transaction failure monitoring and day-over-day comparison reports.

Represents the error code associated with transaction processing outcomes, used to categorize transaction status and calculate success rates in payment processing analytics. This field helps identify specific failure reasons or indicates successful transaction completion.

A JSON varchar field containing extended transaction metadata, primarily used to store the initiationMode and other supplementary information that helps categorize payment transactions into specific business types like QR payments and Intent payments.

A transaction categorization identifier used to classify UPI transactions into different business types (P2P, P2M Collect, QR payments, Intent, Mandate, etc.) based on transaction attributes like category, channel, and initiation mode for success rate analysis and reporting.

The merchant_vpa column stores the Virtual Payment Address (VPA) of the merchant involved in the transaction, used primarily for tracking and analyzing payment failures and error codes associated with specific merchant payment endpoints.

Stores the response code returned by NPCI (National Payments Corporation of India) for UPI payment transactions, indicating the outcome or status of transaction processing at the network level. This code is used in conjunction with application response codes to determine overall transaction success rates and categorize transaction results.

Categorizes transaction participants into business types such as MANDATE, P2P (peer-to-peer), Paytm QR, 3P QR, P2M Collect, and Intent based on transaction category, business type, channel code, and initiation mode. This classification is used for transaction segmentation and success rate analysis across different participant categories.

Virtual Payment Address (VPA) of the payee/recipient in UPI transactions, used to identify the destination account for payment processing and success rate analysis across different transaction categories like P2P, P2M, and QR payments.

The handle portion of the payer's UPI (Unified Payments Interface) identifier, representing the payment service provider or app (e.g., @paytm, @googlepay) through which the transaction was initiated. This field is used in UPI transaction monitoring and success rate analysis to track performance by different payment platforms.

The PSP (Payment Service Provider) handle portion of the payer's UPI virtual payment address, used to identify which payment service provider the payer is using for UPI transactions. This field is primarily used in failure analysis to track and compare transaction failure rates across different PSP handles.

A customer identifier used to scope transaction analysis to specific customer segments or business scopes within the transaction processing system. This column enables filtering and segmentation of transaction data for success rate calculations and performance monitoring across different customer categories.

Indicates the current status of a transaction, with values like 'SUCCESS', 'DEEMED', and various failure states, used primarily to categorize and monitor transaction outcomes in payment processing systems. The column enables tracking of failure rates and success metrics across different time periods for operational monitoring.

Unique identifier for individual transactions in the transaction information snapshot table, used primarily for counting and aggregating transaction volumes when analyzing failure rates and trends across different time periods and banking institutions.

The transaction type indicator that specifies whether a UPI transaction is a 'PAY' (direct payment) or 'COLLECT' (payment request) transaction, used for categorizing transactions into business segments and calculating success rates across different transaction initiation methods.

Virtual Payment Address (VPA) used in UPI transactions to identify payment endpoints. This column stores the virtual address identifiers that are used to categorize and analyze transaction patterns, particularly for error tracking and failure analysis across different payment channels like P2P, merchant payments, and mandate transactions.

A categorical field that classifies UPI transactions into business-specific account types such as P2P, P2M Collect, Paytm QR, 3P QR, Intent, and Mandate based on transaction attributes like category, business type, channel code, and initiation mode. This classification is used for segmented success rate analysis and transaction trend reporting in the UPI payment system.

Represents the monetary amount of a transaction with 2 decimal precision, used in financial analytics to track transaction values across different time periods and failure analysis scenarios. This field enables comparison of transaction amounts between current and previous periods for identifying growth patterns and trends in payment processing.

Application response code that indicates the outcome or status of payment transactions, used in conjunction with NPCI response codes and transaction status to calculate success rates and categorize transaction results across different payment channels and business types.

A varchar field that stores the unique identifier code for banks or financial institutions participating in payment transactions, primarily used for tracking and analyzing transaction failures and error patterns across different banking partners.

A classification field that indicates the type of business transaction, primarily used to identify MANDATE transactions and distinguish them from other payment types like P2P and merchant transactions. This column is key for categorizing transaction flows and calculating success rates across different business transaction types.

Represents the fundamental transaction category for UPI payments, containing values like 'VPA2MERCHANT', 'VPA2VPA', and 'VPA2ACCOUNT' that classify the type of payment flow between different participant types (VPA to merchant, VPA to VPA, VPA to account). This column is used in conjunction with other transaction attributes to derive specific business transaction types for success rate analysis and reporting.

A code that identifies the specific payment channel or integration method used for UPI transactions, such as Paytm QR merchants, online third-party native integrations, or other payment gateways. This field is used to categorize transactions by their origination channel for success rate analysis and business intelligence reporting.

Timestamp indicating when each transaction participant record was created in the system, used for time-based filtering and comparative analysis of transaction failures across different time periods. This column enables day-over-day and hour-by-hour transaction monitoring and growth rate calculations.

This column stores the date when the transaction participant record was last updated or loaded into the data warehouse. It serves as a data lineage timestamp for tracking when snapshot data was refreshed, enabling proper data governance and supporting time-based analytics for transaction monitoring dashboards.

A code that identifies the specific type of error or failure reason for unsuccessful transactions in the payment system. This column is used to categorize transaction failures and track failure growth patterns across different payment participants and time periods.

A varchar field that stores additional contextual information about transaction participants, likely containing supplementary details related to transaction errors, participant characteristics, or failure conditions that support error analysis and failure tracking.

A varchar identifier that represents a unique handle or reference for transaction participants in the UPI payment system, used in conjunction with other fields to categorize and analyze different types of UPI transactions including P2P, P2M, QR payments, and mandates for success rate calculations.

Virtual Payment Address (VPA) identifier for merchant participants in UPI transactions. This field is used to track and analyze merchant-related transaction patterns, failures, and performance metrics across different banking channels.

Contains NPCI (National Payments Corporation of India) response codes that indicate the status or outcome of payment transactions processed through the UPI system. This field is primarily used for monitoring transaction failures and analyzing failure patterns across different time periods for operational dashboards.

Categorizes UPI transaction participants into business types such as P2P, merchant payments, QR codes, mandates, and intents based on transaction characteristics like category, channel, and initiation mode. This classification is used to analyze success rates and transaction patterns across different payment use cases.

The Virtual Payment Address (VPA) of the payee/recipient in UPI transactions, used to identify the money receiver without exposing actual bank account details. This field is essential for tracking transaction participants and analyzing success rates in UPI payment flows.

A unique identifier or handle representing the payment recipient (payee) in financial transactions, used primarily for tracking and analyzing transaction failures and performance metrics across different financial institutions or payment service providers.

A varchar identifier representing the payment service provider (PSP) handle associated with a transaction participant in the UPI payment system. This field is used for tracking and analyzing payment flows and failures across different PSP entities in transaction monitoring dashboards.

A varchar identifier that represents a customer within a specific scope or context for transaction processing and participant tracking. This column is used to identify customers in transaction failure analysis and growth metric calculations within the transaction participants system.

Represents the final outcome status of UPI transactions, with values like 'SUCCESS', 'DEEMED', and various failure statuses. Used primarily in success rate calculations to monitor transaction performance across different remitter banks in UPI payment processing.

Unique transaction identifier used to track and count individual payment transactions in the UPI switch system. This column serves as the primary key for identifying specific payment transactions when analyzing failure rates, success metrics, and transaction volumes across different time periods and bank combinations.

Categorizes the type of UPI/payment transaction (e.g., P2P, MANDATE) based on business rules involving category, business_type, and other transaction attributes. This classification is used for transaction failure analysis and reporting across different payment flows.

Virtual Payment Address (VPA) identifier used to categorize and filter UPI payment transactions in the transaction participants snapshot. This field serves as a key identifier for tracking payment transaction flows and is used in error analysis and failure monitoring dashboards.

A categorical field that classifies UPI payment transactions into specific business types such as P2P, P2M Collect, Paytm QR, 3P QR, Intent, and Mandate based on transaction attributes like category, channel, and initiation mode. This classification is used for calculating success rates and performance metrics across different payment transaction types in the Paytm payments ecosystem.

Represents the monetary value or transaction amount for UPI payments processed through the Paytm system. This column stores the financial value being transferred in each payment transaction and is used for analyzing payment patterns, failure rates, and transaction volumes across different payment categories like P2P and merchant payments.

Application response code for UPI transactions that indicates the status or outcome of payment processing at the application level, used in conjunction with NPCI response codes to determine transaction success rates and monitor UPI payment performance.

Bank code identifier used to categorize payment transaction failures and errors by financial institution in VPA-based transactions. This field enables tracking and comparison of error patterns across different banks for operational monitoring and troubleshooting.

This column categorizes the business type of payment transactions, with values like 'MANDATE' used to distinguish recurring payment setups from other transaction types such as peer-to-peer transfers. It's primarily used for transaction classification and failure analysis in payment processing workflows.

Categorizes UPI transactions into business types such as P2P (person-to-person), MANDATE, and merchant payments based on VPA patterns and transaction characteristics. This categorization is used for analyzing payment failure rates and success patterns across different transaction flows.

Identifies the payment channel or method used for UPI transactions, containing values like 'PAYTM_QR_MERCHANTS', 'PAYTM', and 'ONLINE_3P_NATIVE' that are used to categorize transactions into different payment types (Paytm QR, 3P QR, Intent payments) for success rate analysis and business reporting.

A timestamp column that records when VPA payment transactions were created or initiated in the system. This column is primarily used for time-based analysis and filtering to track payment failure trends and compare transaction volumes across different time periods (daily, hourly comparisons).

A timestamp column that tracks when records in the VPA (Virtual Payment Address) transaction table were last updated in the data lake, primarily used for temporal analysis of payment failures and success rates across different time periods for PSP (Payment Service Provider) comparisons.

Contains error classification codes that identify the specific type or reason for payment transaction failures in the UPI payment system. This column is used for failure analysis and tracking error trends across different bank codes and time periods.

A JSON field containing additional transaction metadata, primarily used to extract initiation mode information for categorizing payment types (QR, Intent, etc.) in UPI transactions. This extended information is crucial for proper transaction classification and success rate analysis across different payment channels.

The handle column stores VPA (Virtual Payment Address) identifiers or handles used in Paytm's UPI payment system, enabling identification and tracking of payment transactions across different categories like P2P, P2M, QR payments, and mandates for success rate analysis.

Stores the Virtual Payment Address (VPA) identifier for merchant accounts in payment transactions. This field is used to identify merchant payees when analyzing transaction failure patterns and calculating failure growth metrics across different time periods.

Contains NPCI (National Payments Corporation of India) response codes that indicate the status or error reason for UPI payment transactions. This column is primarily used in failure analysis to categorize and track different types of payment errors across banks and time periods.

A categorical field that classifies UPI transactions into different participant types (such as P2P, P2M Collect, Paytm QR, Intent, Mandate) based on transaction characteristics like category, business type, channel code, and initiation mode. This column is used to segment success rate analysis across different payment flow types in the Paytm UPI ecosystem.

The Virtual Payment Address (VPA/UPI ID) of the transaction recipient or payee in UPI transactions. This field identifies the destination UPI address where funds are being sent, typically used for filtering and analyzing transaction success rates for specific payee destinations.

The payer_handle column stores the UPI handle portion of the payer's Virtual Payment Address (VPA), identifying the payment service provider or bank through which the payer initiated the transaction. This field is used in failure analysis to track transaction issues by the payer's payment provider.

Payment Service Provider handle identifier used in UPI transaction processing and routing logic. This field is utilized in complex categorization rules to classify different types of UPI transactions (P2P, P2M, QR payments, etc.) for success rate monitoring and analysis.

Customer identifier used to define the scope or segment of customers for payment transaction failure analysis. This field helps categorize and filter transaction data by specific customer groups when analyzing error patterns and failure rates across different banks and time periods.

Represents the final outcome status of UPI payment transactions, containing values like 'SUCCESS', 'DEEMED', and failure statuses. This column is primarily used to calculate success rates (SR) in payment processing analytics, where 'SUCCESS' and 'DEEMED' transactions are considered successful outcomes.

Unique transaction identifier used to count and track individual payment transactions in the Paytm payments system. This ID serves as the primary key for aggregating transaction volumes across different time periods and error categories in payment monitoring dashboards.

Indicates the UPI transaction type, distinguishing between 'PAY' (push payments initiated by payer) and 'COLLECT' (pull payment requests initiated by payee). This field is used to categorize transactions for business analytics and success rate tracking across different payment flows.

Virtual Payment Address (VPA) used in UPI transactions, serving as a unique identifier for users or merchants in the Unified Payments Interface system. This column is used to analyze transaction success rates and categorize different types of UPI payments including peer-to-peer, merchant payments, and QR code transactions.

This column contains the count of transaction failures that occurred on the current day, filtered by creation date. It's used in operational dashboards to monitor daily failure trends and compare current day performance against previous day metrics by error code and payer handle.

Records the total number of transaction failures that occurred on the previous day (yesterday), used for day-over-day failure trend analysis and growth rate calculations in transaction monitoring dashboards.

Represents the total number of transaction failures that occurred on the current date, used for daily failure monitoring and trend analysis comparing current day failures against previous day performance by error code and bank.

This column contains the total number of transaction failures that occurred on the previous day (yesterday), used for day-over-day comparison analysis and failure growth rate calculations in transaction monitoring dashboards.

Represents the total count of failed payment transactions that occurred on the current day, used in error analysis dashboards to track daily failure trends and compare against previous day's performance by error code and payer handle.

Contains the total count of payment transaction failures that occurred on the previous day (yesterday), used for day-over-day failure trend analysis and growth rate calculations in payment monitoring dashboards.

Stores the monetary value of each UPI transaction in the payments system. This field captures the transaction amount being transferred between payer and payee accounts across various flow categories like P2P, merchant payments, and online transactions.

Application response code that indicates the status or result of a UPI transaction from the application layer, used as a fallback when NPCI response codes are unavailable and primarily analyzed for tracking transaction failure patterns and error code distribution.

A varchar field that stores the transaction flow category classification for UPI transactions, used to group transactions into business-relevant categories such as P2P, merchant payments, and online transactions for failure analysis and reporting purposes.

Unique identifier for the customer who is making the payment (payer) in a UPI transaction. This field is used to track and analyze customer transaction patterns, particularly in failure analysis and performance monitoring dashboards.

Date field indicating when the UPI transaction snapshot data was last refreshed or updated in the data lake, used for time-based filtering and partitioning of transaction records for failure analysis and trending.

Categorizes UPI transactions by their flow type (e.g., P2P, 3P QR, Paytm QR, Intent, P2M Collect, Mandate transactions), which is used to group transactions into broader business categories for failure analysis and performance monitoring across different payment channels.

Response code returned by NPCI (National Payments Corporation of India) for UPI transactions, used to identify transaction status and failure reasons. This code is the primary indicator for transaction success or specific error conditions in the UPI payment system.

The name of the bank where the payee (money recipient) holds their account in UPI transactions. This field is used to analyze transaction failure patterns and identify which payee banks are associated with specific error codes or transaction issues.
The unique identifier or virtual payment address (VPA) of the recipient/payee in UPI transactions, used to track and analyze transaction failure patterns and performance metrics by recipient.

Specifies the type of bank account (e.g., savings, current) used by the payer to initiate the UPI transaction. This field helps categorize transactions based on the account type of the sender for analysis and reporting purposes.

The name of the bank or financial institution associated with the payer (money sender) in UPI transactions. This field is used for analyzing transaction success/failure rates and performance metrics across different payer banks in the UPI ecosystem.

A varchar identifier representing the UPI handle (Virtual Payment Address) of the payer who initiates the transaction, used to track and analyze transaction patterns and failure rates by payer identity in the UPI payment system.

A varchar field that stores purpose or category codes used to classify UPI transactions, typically used alongside NPCI response codes for detailed error analysis and transaction categorization in failure monitoring dashboards.

Indicates the completion status of UPI transactions, with values like 'SUCCESS' and 'FAILURE' used to categorize transaction outcomes for performance monitoring and failure analysis across different time periods.

The date key representing the transaction date, used as the primary temporal dimension for filtering and analyzing UPI transaction failures across different time periods, particularly for comparing daily performance against historical averages.

A categorical field that classifies UPI transactions into standardized business types such as P2P (person-to-person), SnP (scan and pay), Online, Onus, and Others based on the underlying flow category. This column is used for segmenting transaction analysis and failure monitoring across different transaction patterns.
Unique identifier for each UPI transaction record, used as the primary counting unit for transaction volume analysis and failure tracking across different time periods in dashboard metrics.

Records the exact date and time when a UPI transaction occurred, stored with millisecond precision. This timestamp is primarily used for temporal analysis, enabling comparison of transaction patterns and failure rates across different time periods in dashboard analytics.

Represents the average daily count of UPI transaction failures over the last 7 days (excluding yesterday), calculated by dividing the total distinct failed transactions from the 7-day period by 7. This metric is used in dashboard comparisons to analyze failure trends against yesterday's performance and calculate percentage changes for monitoring UPI transaction reliability.

This column represents the total number of failed UPI transactions that occurred on the previous day (T-1), used for monitoring and trend analysis by comparing against historical 7-day averages to identify performance anomalies.

A categorical flag that identifies the type of QR code system used for payment transactions, distinguishing between 'Paytm QR' (Paytm's own QR system) and '3P QR' (third-party QR systems) to enable comparison analysis of payment success rates across different QR payment platforms.

Categorizes the type of payment transaction, with values like 'VPA2VPA' (Virtual Payment Address to VPA transfers) and 'VPA2ACCOUNT' (VPA to bank account transfers), used for analyzing success rates across different payment transaction types in competitive analysis against Paytm.

Date field representing the transaction date used for time-based analysis and period-over-period comparisons of P2P payment success rates between Paytm and competitors. This column enables daily aggregation and temporal trending of payment performance metrics.

Hour component (0-23) of when payment transactions occurred, used for temporal analysis and hourly breakdown of transaction success rates and performance metrics in competitive payment system analysis.

A flag indicating whether a payment transaction is associated with a mandate or recurring payment setup, used to categorize and analyze different types of P2P payment transactions in success rate comparisons between Paytm and competitor platforms.

Identifier for the payment recipient or merchant receiving the transaction in the Paytm vs Competition QR success rate analysis. Used to segment transaction performance metrics by payee for comparative analysis between different payment recipients.

This column identifies the payment service provider or entity initiating the transaction, used to filter and segment transaction data for competitive analysis between Paytm and other payment providers.

A varchar field that stores response codes returned from payment transactions, used to categorize transaction outcomes and provide detailed status information for success rate analysis in the Paytm vs competition comparison dashboard.

A categorical field storing standardized response constants or codes associated with payment transactions, used for detailed transaction categorization and analysis alongside the main transaction status in Paytm vs competition success rate comparisons.

Transaction status indicator that tracks the completion state of payment transactions, used to calculate success rates by filtering for successful ('SUCCESS', 'DEEMED') versus total transactions in competitive payment analysis.

Represents the count of individual transactions used to calculate total transaction volumes and success rates in Paytm vs competition QR payment analysis. This column is aggregated to derive key performance metrics like total transactions, successful transactions, and success rate percentages across different time periods.

Represents the total number of transaction attempts (both successful and failed) for QR payments, used as the denominator in success rate calculations for competitive analysis between Paytm and other payment providers.

The transaction date for payment events in the competition analysis, used as the primary time dimension for calculating and comparing Paytm QR payment success rates against competitors across different time periods.
Hour component (0-23) of transaction timestamps, used to analyze hourly patterns in payment transaction success rates and performance comparisons between Paytm and competing payment providers.
Identifies the payment service provider or payer system (e.g., 'Paytm') used for QR code transactions, enabling competitive analysis and performance comparison between different payment platforms.
Represents the count of successful transactions for payment providers in the competition analysis, used to calculate success rates and track performance changes between time periods T1 and T2.
A varchar field that categorizes the type of business or merchant entity involved in UPI transactions, used for business segmentation and analysis within the payment ecosystem.

Categorizes UPI transactions by transfer type, indicating whether the transaction is from a VPA to a merchant (VPA2MERCHANT), another VPA (VPA2VPA), or a bank account (VPA2ACCOUNT). This classification is used for transaction monitoring and success rate analysis across different payment scenarios.
Records the date when the UPI transaction data was last updated or loaded into the data pipeline, used to filter for recent data in real-time monitoring and alerting systems.
Represents the hour component (0-23) extracted from UPI transaction timestamps, used for hourly success rate monitoring and alerting in the dashboard with special handling for cross-day calculations.
Categorizes the type of participant involved in UPI transactions, such as banks, payment service providers, or merchant aggregators, used for participant-specific transaction analysis and monitoring.

The Virtual Payment Address (VPA) of the payer initiating the UPI transaction, containing the complete address in the format username@handle@psp which is used to identify and filter transactions by Payment Service Provider (PSP).

Average success rate used as a baseline for comparison in UPI transaction monitoring alerts. This metric helps identify when current hourly success rates deviate significantly from historical performance patterns.

The status column stores the outcome state of UPI transactions, with values like 'success' and 'deemed' indicating successful transaction completion, used primarily for calculating transaction success rates in business monitoring dashboards.
Unique identifier for UPI transactions used to track and count distinct payment activities for success rate calculations and transaction monitoring.
Stores the timestamp when a UPI transaction occurred, used for time-based analysis and filtering transactions by hour and date in success rate monitoring dashboards.

Categorizes the type of UPI transaction activity, with common values including 'COLLECT' (payment requests) and 'PAY' (direct payments), used to filter and analyze different payment flow patterns in success rate calculations.

A categorical field that classifies transactions or operations by business vertical or payment type, used for segmenting success rate benchmarks and enabling targeted monitoring alerts across different business categories within the Paytm payments ecosystem.

Categorizes UPI transaction types based on the destination, with values including VPA2MERCHANT (payments to merchants), VPA2VPA (peer-to-peer transfers), and VPA2ACCOUNT (transfers to bank accounts), used for filtering transactions in success rate monitoring and benchmarking.

Timestamp indicating when the data record was last updated or loaded into the data pipeline, used to filter for recent data in success rate monitoring and ensure only current records are included in hourly benchmark calculations.
Represents the hour of the day (0-23) extracted from transaction timestamps, used to track and benchmark payment success rates on an hourly basis for real-time monitoring and alerting.

Categorizes the type of payment participant or entity in the UPI payment ecosystem, used for segmenting success rate benchmarks and monitoring across different payment service providers or participant categories.

The Virtual Payment Address (VPA) of the payer initiating the UPI transaction, used to identify and filter transactions processed through specific Payment Service Providers like Paytm for success rate monitoring and benchmarking.
Stores the average/benchmark success rate for hourly payment transactions, used as a reference point for monitoring and alerting on current payment performance deviations.
The status column indicates the outcome state of payment transactions, with values like 'success' and 'deemed' used to calculate success rates for real-time monitoring and alerting purposes.
Unique identifier for each payment transaction used to track and count distinct transactions when calculating success rates and performance metrics in the hourly success rate monitoring system.

Timestamp column that records when a transaction occurred, used for hourly success rate analysis and real-time monitoring in the Paytm payments system. This column enables time-based filtering and grouping for calculating current hour success rates compared to benchmarks.

Categorizes UPI transaction types, specifically distinguishing between 'COLLECT' (payment collection requests) and 'PAY' (direct payment transactions) used for success rate monitoring and benchmarking in the Paytm payment system.
